intro: Alansmia cultrata, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has hairy stems and leaves that help reduce water loss, and it produces small, edible fruits. Alansmia cultrata is often found in desert scrub and creosote bush communities.
